settings.title: "I can feel the difference immediately and has helped me cut back on sugar"
"My go to electrolyte for sugar-free energy"
"The easiest way to cut out sugar and hydrate at the same time"

settings.sub-text: Sweet Success Stories: Hear from those embracing the no-sugar electrolyte solutions.

settings.title: Ocean Electrolytes
settings.subtitle: SODIUM | CHLORIDE | POTASSIUM | MAGNESIUM
settings.text: Naturally-balanced ratios that have nourished our bodies for centuries before modern society for cellular hydration and natural energy.

settings.title: 87+ Trace Minerals
settings.subtitle: BORON | MANGANESE | SILICA | MORE
settings.text: Essential trace minerals that fuels every cell and system, now hard to find because of modern agricultural practices.

settings.title: B Vitamin Complex
settings.subtitle: Plant Powered — B1 | B5 | B6
settings.text:
Curated B Vitamins that support routine electrolyte function and natural energy.

MTHR Note: Methylation is typically only in reference to Vitamins B9 and B12, which we don't use. The ones we use don't come in a methylated form and we do use the cleanest, most absorbable forms of B1, B5, and B6.

settings.title: Antioxidants
settings.subtitle: LESS CITRIC ACID
settings.text: Buoy's potent blend of antioxidants soothe inflammation and keep stable without overdoing it on the citric acid.

settings.title: Ingredients your body can actually absorb
settings.text: Liquid Drops are up to 3x more bioavailable than traditional supplement forms like pills, powders and tablets.

settings.title: For Energy, Gut Health, Brain Function and Skin
The easiest thing you can do for your health
Dr. Lianli Li, Ph.D.
settings.title_location: President Gateway Pharmaceutical, St. Louis, Missouri
settings.content: “Most of us are living our lives under the optimal hydration level. Buoy gives consumers the proper hydration they need, without having to reach for a sugary, artificial sports drink.”

settings.title: Martha Rosenau
settings.content: “My patients with gastrointestinal disease are truly benefiting from Buoy. They are feeling more vibrant and energetic with this amazing blend of electrolytes. Since it’s free of both sugars and zero-calorie sweetener, it’s the perfect way to rehydrate without further aggravating the gastrointestinal tract. Thank you for creating a dietitian’s dream - the perfectly balanced electrolyte replenisher, free of any form of sweetener.”

settings.title: Melissa Nohr
settings.content: “I was diagnosed with POTS a year ago and they make a point to help make daily hydration easier and more accessible to those with chronic illnesses. After using Buoy for one year as a customer, I asked to personally invest in the company.”

settings.text: INVESTING IN SCIENCE
settings.sub-text:
From sugar-laden to sugar-free, Buoy's hydration formula stems from scientists, researchers, pharmaceutical experts, and health professionals that continue to challenge and uphold hydration to higher standards.

✓ Third Party Tested
✓ NonGMO Project Certified
✓ Vegan
✓ Gluten and Major Allergen Free
✓ 3x More Bioavailable Form Factor
✓ Product White Papers
✓ 3 Clinical Studies Started in 2023

settings.title: Why is it important to consider sugar-free electrolyte solutions?
settings.answer:
Too much sugar—like the levels commonly found in electrolyte products—may actually undermine effective hydration by making dehydration symptoms worse based on how sugar interacts with the cells in our body.

When you avoid sugar intake with your electrolytes and fluids, you’re allowing your body to use this essential nutrition to fuel every cell and system as intended, leading to optimal hydration in the long run instead of diverting them to balance the increased sugar levels in our blood and body.

settings.title: How do sugars typically affect the body's hydration process?
settings.answer:
With a moderate amount of sugar intake, our cells begin to transfer more water leading to increased urination. This means you’re passing those important electrolytes, minerals and fluids you need for optimal hydration likely before your body would originally do so.

When you have higher blood sugar levels, your body tries to balance by borrowing water from other tissues and places, meaning that the water and electrolytes are going towards neutralizing the sugar rather than supporting optimal health.

settings.title: What makes Buoy's no-sugar electrolytes effective in hydration without added sugars?
settings.answer:
While it’s true that a miniscule amount of glucose can help sodium absorption in the body, it’s not the only sodium co-transporting molecule around.

Buoy’s baseline hydration formula is brimming with a curated plant-based B vitamin complex that specifically supports routine electrolyte function in our bodies so you’re getting more out of every sip.

Additionally, Buoy’s naturally-sourced electrolyte profile is packed with 87 ionic trace minerals and biological elements that complete a comprehensive hydration profile that nurtures well beyond the macro-mineral profile that so many electrolyte products focus on.

settings.title: Are there natural sweeteners or flavors in Buoy's electrolyte products?
settings.answer:
No. Buoy is purposefully unflavored and unsweetened to optimize for function, not flavor.

Even the other zero sugar electrolyte options are loaded with sweeteners that may spike blood sugar levels, promote inflammation within our tissues and maybe loaded with additives and chemicals commonly found in “Natural” flavors.

As important as it is to look out for sugar in hydration products, it’s also important to read the label for sweeteners like stevia, dextrose, monk fruit and natural flavors as they may exacerbate existing health issues or generate inflammation that undermines optimal hydration.

settings.title: How does Buoy ensure taste without adding sugars to its electrolytes?
settings.answer:
Buoy’s delivery and form factor allows its naturally sourced electrolytes and minerals to dissolve instantly and evenly in any drink without compromising taste.

We worked with a pharmaceutical expert and our Scientific Advisory Board to make effective hydration with as neutral of a flavor profile as possible—reducing the amount of citric acid needed to keep Buoy shelf stable and finding the world’s most potent ingredient sources.

Buoy’s form factor is up to three times more bioavailable than traditional supplement forms like pills, powders and tablets. Because of it’s highly concentrated formulation, we’re able to dose enough electrolytes and minerals per serving into a full drink without changing it’s taste.

settings.title: Can I achieve proper hydration with sugar-free electrolytes alone?
settings.answer:
Hydration is two parts: fluids—or water—and electrolytes.

Long before modern society, these two weren’t thought of separately: our water was naturally electrolyte rich from erosion and the clay beds the leech minerals into the bodies of water reside on top of them.

When you add sugar into the mix, your body introduces metabolic reactions that actually trigger urination and deviate the electrolytes and fluids needed to support optimal hydration across your body to balance the now higher blood sugar levels.

So while you always need fluids and water to pair with your electrolytes, you can easily achieve proper hydration with sugar-free electrolytes. You likely have enough glucose stored in your body to help with any additional sodium absorption or you can get electrolytes like Buoy that have potassium and a curated B vitamin complex to support electrolyte function.

settings.title: Are there any potential health benefits of switching to no-sugar electrolytes?
settings.answer:
Eliminating sugar consumption from your electrolyte intake is a wise move that promotes health and vitality with long-term transformation.

Stable energy: While sugar provides a short-term energy boost, it leaves you with less energy than you started with after the crash. After you pass the sugar out in urination, your blood sugar crashes which carries physical implications like fatigue to mental cognition declines like less motivation and focus.

Reduced risk of chronic illness: Excessive and consistent sugar intake is a gateway for long-term and persistent health implications like heart disease, obesity, chronic inflammation, high blood pressure and chronic illnesses like Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes.

Weight loss: Studies consistently reinforce the idea that sugar intake in moderate to excess amounts are likely to lead to obesity and weight gain overtime. Worse—sugar intake is linked to more cravings, which may cause your total caloric intake to go up on a consistent basis leading to weight gain. Furthermore, when trying to manage or lose weight, excess sugar will undermine your goals.

Healthier skin: Healthy, glowing and radiant skin is one of the benefits to cutting out sugar from your diet. Sugar intake causes our bodies to age faster and reduce the healthy proteins and collagen we need to make our skin supple and healthy. While sugar intake impacts us all differently, cleaning up your diet by removing sugar—especially refined sugar—seems to hold true for almost everyone: healthier, clearer skin.

Improved cognitive and brain health: With excess sugar in the body, you may become more insulin resistant which leads to a lessened ability to balance blood sugar in the long run. When this happens, your risk for neurodegenerative disorders like Alzheimer’s disease and others increases.

Shaper memory: Sugar intake impacts our bodies insulin response, which impacts our brain’s synaptic connections. With excessive or consistent sugar intake, insulin and these hormone connections are hindered, directly impacting our brain’s memory and ability to learn.

Reduced anxiety: When you consume sugar, our blood sugar spikes which is a common cause of brain fog. After we pass the sugar, our blood sugar dips, which is a common trigger of anxiety.

Reduced depression: Sugar directly impacts the neurotransmitter serotonin in our brain. If it’s overstimulated from excess sugar, we’re at higher risk of depleting the chain of these neurotransmitters which is one of the stronger links to mood disorders.

settings.title: How do Buoy's sugar-free electrolytes compare to traditional sports drinks?
settings.answer:
Buoy is formulated by a pharmaceutical expert and Scientific Advisory Board of medical professionals for fast-acting, effective hydration. Unlike traditional sports drinks which are loaded with sugar, additives and other ingredients that undermine effective hydration in the long run, Buoy’s naturally sourced electrolyte and mineral profile delivers comprehensive and essential hydration in a more bioavailable form factor that can be added to any beverage for fast absorption.

Each serving of Buoy is ⅓ the electrolytes of a sports drink without the sugar, sweeteners, flavors, calories, additives or junk. Each bottle has 40 servings, or more electrolytes than 13 sports drinks.

settings.title: Do Buoy's no-sugar electrolytes cater to specific dietary needs or restrictions?
settings.answer:
Buoy is formulated for even the most restrictive diets, including those fasting and living with chronic illnesses. It’s purposefully unflavored and unsweetened formula stacks seamlessly with intermittent fasting, keto, paleo, Whole30 and other health-focused diets while also serving the allergen-conscious, NonGMO and Vegan crowd.

Furthermore, two of Buoy’s three clinical studies revolves around Buoy’s effectiveness at supporting chronic illnesses because of its naturally sourced ingredients and commitment to avoiding the sweet and inflammatory ingredients like sugar and sugar alternatives that exacerbate health conditions and generate inflammation.

settings.text: New to fasting or just getting started?

settings.title: Why Go Sugar-Free?
settings.text:
Excessive and persistent sugar intake leads to some not so sweet health implications like heart disease, obesity and chronic illnesses.

Those who cut back can expect improved physical and mental health benefits, sometimes much sooner than expected.

settings.title: Physical Benefits Of Removing Sugar
settings.text:
Sugar intake often provides short-lived benefits that undermine physical health and performance.

✅ Balanced Energy — With sugar, you’ll enjoy a small energy boost when your blood sugar spikes. When it drops, your energy levels will rise alongside it, leaving you feeling more tired than before.

Without sugar, your body will maintain stable and balanced energy levels as long as you’re providing it with some of the fundamental nutrients like electrolytes, minerals and vitamins it needs to fuel bodily functions.

✅ Stable Immune System — Sugar consumption leads to higher blood sugar levels which triggers an inflammatory immune response. Overtime, chronic inflammation can damage your body’s immune system and its ability to fight infections. At a certain point, your immune system struggles to properly identify what to focus on and can damage itself and your own tissues and cells, a class of disorders known as autoimmune diseases.

✅ Weight Management — Sugar intake not only increases cravings and, ultimately, your caloric intake, but it also makes shedding stored fat a harder task than it needs to be. The studies linking sugar intake to obesity are clear and cutting back allows room to manage or lose weight effectively.

✅ Better Digestion — Sugar is one of the worst things we can consume for our gut health and its delicate microbiome balance. Our bodies can only handle so much sugar at once. When consumed in excess, it’s left to sit in our GI Tract and bowels where it ferments, feeding bad bacteria, and thus will move even slower through our digestive system.

✅ Clearer Skin — Sugar consumption reduces our protein and collagen production which undermines healthy skin aging and its suppleness. Furthermore, certain people will show sugar’s inflammation in their skin as acne and other blemishes.

✅ Reduced Chance Of Chronic Illnesses — Elevated blood sugar levels and inflammation from sugar consumption is a springboard for some of the leading health concerns in modern society: obesity, heart disease and autoimmune disorders.

settings.title: Mental Benefits Of Removing Sugar
settings.text:
As stated above, sugar’s negative impacts reach to every cell and system in our bodies. Beyond the more traditionally known impacts to our physical health and performance, sugar damages brain health and undermines optimal function.

✅ Protection against neurodegenerative disorders — Overtime, sugar intake impacts our insulin resistance and ability to balance blood sugar, one of the key markers medical professionals use to assess your risk for Alzheimer’s disease and other neurodegenerative disorders.

✅ Stable Mood — At a biochemical level, anxiety and depression and the neurotransmitters and chemistry that governs them, are linked to sugar consumption. For feelings of anxiety, the inevitable dip in blood sugar leaves people feeling anxious. For depressive moods, sugar consumption provides an immediate dopamine release and along with it, the neurotransmitter serotonin which overtime, will get overwhelmed and depleted, promoting mood irregularities.

✅ Better Motivation and Focus — With higher blood sugar levels, the insulin response in our bodies will hinder certain hormone connections in our brain that govern memory, focus and optimal cognition.

settings.title: Buoy's Commitment
settings.text:
Buoy’s promise is to provide the world’s best ingredient sources in their most bioavailable form without the sugar, sweeteners, additives, calories or carbs found in most hydration and electrolyte options.

With so many electrolyte and hydration products optimizing for taste and flavor, getting your essential nutrition without the sugar becomes a challenge.

Even the zero electrolyte options contain sweeteners like stevia and natural flavors that trigger inflammatory responses and undermine health in the long run. Buoy’s started with a mission to focus on function, not flavor. Every electrolyte product is formulated and optimized for efficacy and long-term health transformations:

settings.title:
The Health Horizon

The bittersweet truth: sugar is impacting everything from your weight to your mood and even moderate amounts can be detrimental to health and vitality.
settings.link_text: Try The Cleanest Electrolytes On Earth —>

settings.title: Natural Hydration Heroes
settings.text:
Did you know avocados have more potassium than bananas? Here's a grocery list electrolyte rich foods packed with minerals to electrify your diet:

Roots — Some roots like Beets are electrolyte superstars rich in both the principle electrolytes but also important trace minerals like, Managnese, Phosphorus, Iron, Zinc, Copper, Boron, Silica and Selenium.

Leafy Greens — Healthy foods like collards, kale, spinach and others tend to be high in Calcium, Magnesium, Manganese and Iron.

Fruits — Avocadoes, Watermelon, raspberries, bananas and coconuts can be a great, refreshing source of the principle electrolytes, yet for those watching their sugar intake it would be wise to prioritize the food higher on the list.

Vegetables — Tomatoes, cucumbers and sweet potatoes are electrolyte and mineral dense food, especially if buying from organic and regenerative farmed soil.

settings.title: When Diet Meets Dehydration
settings.text:
Cutting back on your sugar consumption is one of the biggest factors to balancing a healthy diet.

Not only does sugar impact your physical and mental health, but it completely disrupts your gut's microbiome and ability to process and digest food.

Our bodies can only handle so much sugar at once and the excess is sits in our bowels where it begins to ferment and feed bad gut bacteria. The fermented sugar makes its way through our digestive system at a much slower pace than normal food, prolonging the damage and inflammation to our gut's lining, bacteria balance and immune response.

Even if eating a healthy diet, too much sugar can compromise your gains elsewhere.

Bottled water, even spring water, goes through production processes that strip beneficial micronutrients out. What’s left is a mineral content that’s just enough to market, but not enough to matter, especially when it comes to trace minerals.
